article_content: Home Travel Travel Diary 5 / 5 Article Left 5 Cheapest Markets In Noida For A Budget-Friendly Shopping Experience If you put up in Noida, here is an easy way to save costs. Visit these local markets in the city for affordable and quality shopping. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-20, 09:28 IST Living in an expensive city like Delhi and Noida can be tough in terms of financial management. With soaring real estate prices and a lavish lifestyle, one may spend more than they earn to make ends meet in this bustling city. However, to manage your situation better, you can easily make cuts in your costs by spending money in local markets. If you're living in Noida, here are some of the cheapest markets in the city where you can shop for almost anything including clothes, electronics, home decor, etc. at pocket-friendly rates, Cheapest Markets In Noida Atta Market,Noida Situated in Sector 18, Noida, Atta Market is a heaven for tshopoholics. This massive market near the Sector 18 metro station and opposite DLF Mall, incorporates hundreds of shops selling clothes, home decor, electronics, phone covers, books and stationary, and footwear. Ensure that you bargain here to get the best price for your desired items. View this post on Instagram A post shared by noida gram (@noidagram) Harola Market,Noida Situated amid the bustling lanes of Noida’s Harola, Harola Market is a one-stop shop for all your needs and wants. Many grocery stores here sell essentials at a lower price than MRP. you can also shop for clothes and accessories here at pocket-friendly rates. The market stays shut on Sundays. Sunehri Market,Noida Noida’s Sunehri Market is situated in Sector 27, near Noida Sector 18 Metro Station . This market is a paradise for fashionistas as you can get trendy and stylish clothing and accessories for cheap rates. Make sure to bargain with the seller to get your desired items at a favourable rate. Don't Miss: Clothing To Lighting: Your Complete Shopping Guide To Chandni Chowk Market This Festive Season Brahmaputra Market,Noida Located in Sector 29, Brahmaputra Market or BP Market is the perfect place to visit for affordable shopping experiences. Here you can find a variety of clothes, accessories, footwear, electronic devices, and even food. Shahberi Furniture Market, Noida If you are looking forward to buying new furniture for your house at pocket-friendly prices, visit Shahberi Furniture Market in Greater Noida Sector 10. Here, you can find a variety of furniture and home decor varying in sizes, designs, craftsmanship, and more. title: Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve: Glowing Forest Of India | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Travel Travel Diary 5 / 5 Article Left Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve: Glowing Forest Of India Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve, where the forests come alive with a mesmerising glow during the monsoon season. Explore one of India’s best-kept hidden secrets and unravel the mysteries of India's glowing forests. Amit Diwan Editorial Updated - 2024-06-20, 10:14 IST Nature never fails to astound us with its wonders, and the glowing forests of the Western Ghats in Maharashtra and Goa are a testament to this. As per Holidify, at Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary, a stunning phenomenon occurs wherein the forest takes on a captivating green glow at night during the monsoon season. Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve: Glowing Forest Of India According to Holidify , this unusual yet beautiful phenomenon is caused by a unique bacteria called Mycena, which has the remarkable property of glowing when there is an abundance of moisture in the surroundings. These bacteria settle like fungi on branches, twigs, and rotting leaves throughout the forest, resulting in the entire landscape illuminating with a mesmerising glow. This spectacular visual, termed bioluminescence, is particularly witnessed in the little-known village of Ahupe during the monsoon season. Scientists are still unravelling the mysteries behind why these bacteria exhibit this glowing property, making it a subject of ongoing research and fascination. As per THolidify, the unique bacteria are not the sole reason for the glowing forests. The Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary and other regions in the Western Ghats are home to fireflies, which also contribute to the enchanting illumination of the forests at night. This amazing display can be best experienced during a night trek to nearby attractions like Rajmachi Fort or Bhandardara. Don't Miss: 5 Hill Stations Near Chandigarh You Shouldn't Miss Best Time to Visit Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve, Maharashtra While the bioluminescence phenomenon doesn't occur every day, you may be fortunate enough to witness it after an evening of heavy rainfall during the monsoon months of July, August, and September. Fireflies, on the other hand, can be easily spotted in the pre-monsoon months of May and June. Don't Miss: 10 Days Rajasthan Itinerary: Journey Through Nature and Wildlife Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve Maharashtra Spread across an area of 131 square kilometres, the Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve is located in the Khed and Ambegaon areas of Pune District, Western Ghats. Established in 1984 to protect the endangered Indian Giant Squirrel, the reserve is home to a diverse array of flora and fauna, including leopards, striped hyenas, golden jackals, barking deer, wild boars, langurs, and mouse deer. With its trekking trails, rich wildlife, bioluminescent forests, and the revered Bhimashankar Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, the Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve offers a captivating experience for nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers alike. Easily accessible by road and rail, this destination promises an unforgettable journey into the heart of India's glowing forests. title: 4 Best Monsoon Treks In North India For June, July, August 2024  | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Travel Travel Diary 5 / 5 Article Left 4 Monsoon Treks In North India To Do In 2024 For A Thrilling Adventure If trekking is something where you fully lose yourself and immerse in a meditative state, pack your rucksacks and board the bus to some of the most thrilling monsoon treks in North India. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 16:31 IST Trekking is one of the most daunting activities. It truly challenges your physical and mental strength and teaches determination, perseverance, and endurance, helping you build character. You can do an exhilarating trek throughout the year according to your preferred season, place, and difficulty. With the onset of monsoon season, indulge in an exciting monsoon trek in these North Indian destinations to relish greenery at its best along with a sea of clouds below your feet. Monsoon Treks In North India Hampta Pass, Manali, Himachal Pradesh Nestled in the Kullu district of Himachal Pradesh, the Hampta Pass trek lies amid breathtaking views and rivers. The 28 km-long trek in the Valley of Flowers of Himachal begins at Kullu Valley and stretches till Lahaul Spiti. Located at an altitude of over 14,000 feet, the trek can be completed within 5 days, according to Himalaya Shelter. Kashmir Great Lakes, Kashmir Stretching for 7 days, the Kashmir Great Lakes trek can be one of the most mesmerising experiences of your life. You can witness seven alpine lakes, meadows, rugged mountains, and immaculate beauty during this trek that begins at Shitkadi Village and ends at Naranag, according to Trek The Himalayas. The moderate to difficult terrain is at an altitude of over 13,000 feet and is about 70 km long. Don't Miss: Jibhi Travel Guide: From Journey To Destination, Here’s How To Reach Here From New Delhi Valley of Flowers Trek and Hemkund Sahib, Uttarakhand Situated in the peaks of Uttarakhand, the Valley of Flowers trek is one of the most exhilarating monsoon treks to do with your friends. Surrounded by freshly bloomed flowers and unfathomable greenery, the trek is 47 km long and stretches for 5-6 days, according to Himalaya Shelter. At 14,400 feet, enjoy the trek along with a mesmerising visit to the highest Gurudwara in the world, Sri Hemkund Sahib. George Everest, Uttarakhand Nestled in the Queen of Hills, Mussoorie, Uttarakhand , George Everest is an easy 4 km-long trek that begins at Hathipaon Chowk, according to India Treks. Walk through trails of greenery amid clouds all around you during monsoon season. The trek can be completed within 3 hours, depending on your speed and strength. title: Tips To Avoid Sunburn During Mountain Trek | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Travel Travel Diary 5 / 5 Article Left How To Protect Yourself From Sunburn During A Mountain Trek So, next time when the mountains call, don’t miss out on the below-given tips to protect yourself from sunburn. Aparna Sharma Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 16:35 IST Mountain excursions are all fun and thrilling until you get a severe sunburn. At the high altitudes, atmospheric filtering of UV rays is typically low and radiation increases by 4%, therefore, leading to a nasty tan. Protecting your skin in the mountains is even more important as compared to when on the beach. All you need to do is wear the right sunscreen, clothes and accessories. Tips To Avoid Sunburn During Mountain Trek So, next time when the mountains call, don’t miss out on the below-given tips to protect yourself from sunburn. Cover Up Image Courtesy: Days Of The Year When you're out in the sun, cover up to protect yourself from sun damage. Pull your sleeves down to cover your arms and keep your neck and ears shaded. Wearing a sun hat or a broad-brimmed hat can help shield these areas. If you misplace your sunhat, you can use a scarf as an alternative. Simply wrap it around to cover up. When trekking with just a peak cap, tuck the scarf under the cap to cover your neck and ears effectively. Don't Miss: Protect Your Skin This Summer With Tips Shared By Shahnaz Husain Never Skip Sunscreen Image Courtesy: Exped Review Sunscreen is an absolute must while on a high altitude (and in daily life). Your face and hands are the most exposed parts of your body which makes them more susceptible to sunburn. Choose sunscreen rated above SPF 40. Apply it 30 minutes before stepping out. Reapply sunscreen every 2 hours while in the mountains. Apply abundantly. You need a good layer of sunscreen to do its work effectively. Don't Miss: DIY Tan Removal Face Packs To Restore Your Natural Glow Wear Sunglasses And A Hat Image Courtesy: www.zealoptics.com UV rays harm both your skin and eyes. Short-term exposure can cause snow blindness, while long-term exposure can lead to cataracts. Snow blindness, or photokeratitis, occurs when your eyes are sunburned due to snow reflecting sunlight and UV rays. Trekking in the snow without eye protection can damage your cornea, causing a gritty, burning feeling in the eyes and temporary vision loss. To prevent this discomfort, wear UV protection sunglasses when trekking on snow for an extended period. Not to forget the sun hat as it shields your eyes and face from the direct sun rays. title: 5 Forests In India That You Can Visit In Monsoons | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Travel Travel Tips & Reviews 5 / 5 Article Left 5 Forests In India That You Can Visit In Monsoons Monsoon Magic in India! Trek misty trails, witness waterfalls roar, and explore five hidden gems. Unforgettable adventures await in these lush monsoon forests. Amit Diwan Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 14:17 IST As the monsoon clouds gather, India's forests transform into vibrant, living tapestries. The air fills with the earthy aroma of wet soil and blooming flora, while streams and rivers swell with fresh rainwater. Wildlife thrives in this abundance, creating a spectacle that beckons nature enthusiasts. According to TripAdvisor, these five forests offer unforgettable monsoon experiences. Forests In India That You Can Visit In Monsoons Periyar National Park, Kerala Nestled in the Western Ghats , Periyar National Park becomes a lush green haven during monsoons. The park's rich biodiversity comes alive, with elephants, tigers, and countless bird species revelling in the rain-soaked landscape. The centrepiece, Periyar Lake, offers enchanting boat safaris amidst the misty surroundings. How to reach: By air: Fly to Cochin International Airport (140 km from the park) By road: Take a taxi or bus from Kumily town (4 km away) Agumbe Rainforest, Karnataka Known for its heavy rainfall, Agumbe Rainforest is a monsoon marvel. Its dense forests teem with unique amphibians and reptiles. Visitors can witness breathtaking sunsets and explore the majestic Barkana and Jogigundi waterfalls. How to reach: By train: Arrive at Shimoga railway station (90 km away) By air: Fly to Mangalore airport (150 km away) By bus: Take an overnight KSRTC bus from Bengaluru Don't Miss: Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve: Glowing Forest Of India Valley of Flowers National Park, Uttarakhand This UNESCO World Heritage Site transforms into a colourful carpet of alpine flowers during monsoon. Trekkers and nature lovers flock to witness the vibrant meadows set against snow-capped Himalayan peaks. How to reach : By road: Drive to Govind Ghat (11 hours from Dehradun, plus 1 hour to Gobindghat) On foot: Trek 13 km from Gobindghat to Ghangaria base camp Amboli, Maharashtra Tucked away in the Sahyadri Hills, Amboli comes alive with lush greenery and cascading waterfalls during monsoon. Its dense forests harbour rare and endemic species, making it a biodiversity hotspot. How to reach: By train: Take a train to Sawantwadi railway station (30 km away) By road: Buses and taxis available from major cities like Mumbai and Goa Don't Miss: 4 Monsoon Treks In North India To Do In 2024 For A Thrilling Adventure Kheerganga, Himachal Pradesh The Kheerganga Trek offers a mesmerising monsoon experience in the Parvati Valley. At an altitude of 2,950 metres, trekkers encounter ever-changing landscapes, from lush forests to snow-covered peaks. How to reach: By train: Take a direct train from Delhi to Bhuntar By road: Take a taxi or local bus from Bhuntar to Barshaini (trek starting point) Each of these forests offers a unique monsoon adventure, showcasing India's incredible natural diversity. From Kerala's tropical greenery to Himachal's misty mountains, monsoon transforms these landscapes into magical realms waiting to be explored. article_content: Home Life & Women Society & Culture 5 / 5 Article Left 4 DIY Home Decor Ideas For Your Child’s Bedroom Here is a list of four easy DIY home decor ideas for your child’s bedroom. Keep reading to learn more. Shivangi Sarkar Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 20:49 IST Your bedroom is your sanctuary, and that shouldn’t be any different for kids. With easy materials lying around your home, you can elevate your kid’s bedroom with DIY home decor. Here is a list of four easy DIY home decor ideas for your child’s bedroom. Keep reading to learn more. DIY Home Decor Ideas For Kids’ Bedroom We've curated a list of easy DIY home decor ideas for your kids' bedrooms. Home Decor Idea For Kids’ Bedroom: A Tent Bed First on the list is a tent bed. It is every kid's dream to have a sleepover under the stars when they go camping. You can now make your kid’s dream come true by constructing a DIY tent bed. All you have to do is gather a big white bed sheet, three big wooden sticks and some rope. Create a tent with the help of the bedsheet, make it stable with wood or bamboo sticks, and finally step it up with a thick rope by tying the wooden sticks together. Home Decor Idea For Kids’ Bedroom: A Tutu Table If your child is a fan of princesses , then this DIY home decor idea should be your pick. Buy a miniature, pristine white side table for your child’s bedroom. Take a bright pink tutu skirt and wrap it around the table. Instead of a boring table cover, a tutu table cover not only adds fun but also adds colour to your child’s room. Home Decor Idea For Kids’ Bedroom: A Craft Station Create a personalised craft station for your child's bedroom to nurture their creativity. You can use a small wooden table or an existing desk in your child's room. Gather various art supplies, such as paint brushes, paint, glitter, crayons, glue, and child-safe scissors, and set up a customised craft station. Additionally, place a canvas stand with a blank canvas next to the station to inspire your child's artistic talent. Don't Miss: 15+ Romantic Quotes To Wish Your Beloved Good Night Home Decor Ideas For Kids’ Bedroom: Hand-Painted Walls For an immersive experience with your child, you can try hand painting the walls of their room. Pour 3-4 different colours of paint onto buckets, wear an apron, and get ready to paint! Don’t be afraid to get messy as you dip your hand in the paint and put an imprint on the wall. Continue the process until you achieve your desired aesthetic. title: How To Grow Papaya From Seeds? | Step-By-Step Guide | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Life & Women Society & Culture 5 / 5 Article Left How To Grow Papaya From Seeds? Here’s A Step-By-Step Guide Are you a gardening enthusiast? If yes, here are some easy steps to grow a papaya plant at home with its seeds. Check out the article for a simple tutorial. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 21:09 IST Grown in tropical climates, Papaya is a delicious, nutritious, and juicy fruit with many health benefits. The fruit that originated in southern Mexico and Central America, is now grown all over the world. The nutrition-packed fruit aids in digestion and is great for your skin. You can make homemade beauty masks with the fruit’s essence. If you are willing to utilise the fruit to its every bit, use its seeds to grow a papaya plant at home using these easy steps. How To Grow Papaya From Seeds? Seed Preparation Collect the seeds: The centre of a papaya fruit is loaded with seeds. Scoop them out and obtain the seeds in a bowl. Clean the seeds: Papaya seeds are covered with juicy and sticky pulp which needs to be washed off before planting. Rub the seeds against a mesh strainer and soak them in water for about two days. Once done, clean them thoroughly and leave them to dry on a tissue for a few days. Planting Papaya Seeds Take pots or a seed tray and fill it up with a well-draining, pre-moistened seed starting mix or soil. Sow the seeds about ¼ inch deep in the soil. Plant 2-3 seeds per pot as papayas have a low probability of germination. Place your pots in a spot with immense indirect sunlight. Constantly moisten the soil but do not make it soggy. Papayas take time to grow, hence the seeds could take as long as 2-3 weeks to germinate. Don't Miss: 5 Summer Plant Care Tips To Shield Your Green Friends From Heat Waves After Gemination After your seeds have germinated into tiny seedlings with a few leaves, thin them keeping only their strong parts. After your plant has grown about 6 inches tall, transfer them into larger pots or your garden, if you have enough space and a snow-free climate. Caring For Papaya Papaya trees need full sun, however, keep them under indirect light if it's too hot. Water regularly to keep the soil moist. However, let it dry a little in between watering. Add fertiliser to your tree once a month to ensure it is thriving. Papaya trees grow best during summer and repel colder climates. If you live in a cold place, grow them indoors. Don't Miss: Step-By-Step Guide To Growing Coriander At Home From Stem Cuttings You must stay patient growing papaya plants as they need time to bear fruits. article_content: Home Life & Women Society & Culture 5 / 5 Article Left Kabir Das Jayanti 2024: 10+ Quotes And Dohas That Will Inspire You Today is Kabir Das Jayanti that is celebrated every year on June 22. Literature enthusiasts and Sufi followers must celebrate this day with Kabir Das’s famous quotes and done with English translations. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 09:55 IST Today is Kabir Das Jayanti 2024. Indian poet and mystic, Kabir Das was born in the 14th century AD in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh. The saint wrote in Hindi, Bhojpuri, Braj, and Awadhi languages. Every year, on June 22, we celebrate Kabir Das Jayanti to celebrate his soulful Sufi poetry, quotes, and dohe. Here are some of Kabir Das’s most famous quotes and dohe translated into English. Kabir Das Jayanti 2024 Quotes Here are some motivating quotes by Kabir Das for inspiration: “All know that the drop merges into the ocean but few know that the ocean merges into the drop.” “Do what you do with another human being, but never put them out of your heart.” “For millions of years you have slept. This morning, will you not wake?” “If you want the truth, I’ll tell you the truth. Listen to the secret sound, the real sound, which is inside you.” “The river that flows in you also flows in me.” “Listen to your own Self. If you listen to that Self within, then you find the truth.” “I felt in need of a great pilgrimage ( Pilgrimage Near Delhi ), so I sat still for three days and God came to me.” “The truth of love is the truth of the universe: it is the lamp of the soul that reveals the secrets of darkness.” Don't Miss: 15+ Motivational Quotes By Lord Krishna To Brighten Up Your Day Kabir Das Dohe Here are some famous Kabir Das’s dohas and their meanings to share on social media : तूँ तूँ करता तूँ भया, मुझ मैं रही न हूँ। वारी फेरी बलि गई, जित देखौं तित तूँ ॥ Meaning: Chanting the Lord’s name constantly made me forget myself (ego), now wherever I look, I only see the almighty. मेरा मुझ में कुछ नहीं, जो कुछ है सो तेरा। तेरा तुझकौं सौंपता, क्या लागै है मेरा॥ Meaning: I don’t have anything of myself left within me, all that I ever owned, I dedicate to you (almighty). Now that I don’t possess anything, I am not attached to materialistic pleasures. पोथी पढ़ि-पढ़ि जग मुवा, पंडित भया न कोइ। एकै आखर प्रेम का, पढ़ै सो पंडित होइ॥ Meaning: Those who read books cover to cover are not real Pandits (sage, wisemen), those who chant a single name of the almighty have gained real wisdom. बिरह जिलानी मैं जलौं, जलती जलहर जाऊँ। मो देख्याँ जलहर जलै, संतौ कहा बुझाऊँ॥ Meaning: A woman estranged from her lover goes to the lake in distress, however, the fire within her chest makes even the lake catch flames. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 10:15 IST Master of Business Administration or MBA is one of the most esteemed degrees or postgraduate diplomas to help you earn a well-paying and respectable job. This program is also helpful for those individuals who intend to build their business ventures as it teaches the detailed principles and practicality of administration and management. Therefore, it is essential to pursue the course at a renowned institute. Many foreign universities offer MBA programs for students all over the world. Despite its soaring demand and fees, certain countries provide affordable MBA fees for Indian students. Check them out here. Cheapest Countries To Study MBA Abroad For Indian Students MBA In Germany Germany is known for its affordable education and public universities. With top-notch faculty, amenities, facilities, and campus, some German universities that you can apply to include Humboldt Universität, Berlin School of Economics & Law, University of Hamburg, Grenoble Ecole de Management, Munich Business School, and HHL Leipzig Graduate School of Management. The MBA fees may range between INR 16.5-39.13 lakhs annually. MBA InNorway For those with a strict budget, Norway is a great option for MBA as the universities here offer education without fee. Apply to universities such as BI Norwegian Business School, NHH – Norwegian School of Economics, Norwegian University of Science and Technology, University of Oslo, and the University of Agder for quality education and job opportunities. The living cost here amounts to approximately INR 1,02,160 monthly. It is highly preferred due to its affordable tuition fee and cost of living. The free here ranges between INR 5.17-22.28 lakhs per year, making it preferable for Indian students. article_content: Home Life & Women Society & Culture 5 / 5 Article Left How To Wash Shoes In The Washing Machine: A Step-By-Step Guide Here are the simple steps to clean your shoes in a machine for a spotless wash. Aparna Sharma Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 13:30 IST Muddy, grimy shoes seem impossible to clean at first! Normally, it would take a lot of your time and effort to remove the last bit of dirt, but not with a washing machine. It makes your routine footwear cleaning effortless and less time-consuming. However, not all shoes are the best match for machine wash, so it's important to do your research first! Athletic shoes made of polyester or nylon can handle the agitation and emerge looking clean. Heavy cotton or canvas shoes can also withstand the deep cleaning of machine wash. How To Wash Shoes In The Washing Machine Here are the simple steps to clean your shoes in a machine for a spotless wash. Remove Laces And Insoles Laces and insoles can restrict the free movement in the washer. Therefore, it's advised to remove both before starting the washing process. Knock out dried mud or other debris from the bottom of the soles. Don't Miss: Oh So Spotless Treat Spots Wet the shoes for easy scrubbing. Now take a brush and dip it in liquid detergent or soap flakes mixed with water. Take your shoes and start scrubbing the stains from midsoles and uppers with a brush. Don't Miss: 5 Ways To Clean At Home Using Vinegar, Baking soda and other ingredients at home Machine Wash Shoes Place shoes in a mesh laundry bag or zippable pillowcase and put them inside the washing machine . Add towels to balance the load. Add detergent or soap flakes and set the machine to a delicate wash in cold water. Don't Miss: How To Clean White Canvas Shoe With Baking Soda Don't Miss: Lake Appliance Repair Deodorise Insoles Don’t leave out the insoles. Place them in a shoebox, bag or bin. Sprinkle baking soda over insoles and leave overnight. Hand Wash Laces Washing laces can be a bit tricky but not with this easy trick! Fill your sink with warm, soapy water. Let it soak for 15 minutes before scrubbing with a soapy brush. Soaking them in warm water will help easily get rid of the stubborn dirt. Finish by rinsing with water. Air Dry Shoes Remove shoes and towels from the water. Throw towels in the dryer and shoes under the natural sunlight and air. Hang or drape the laces outside to dry with the shoes. Shake out insoles to remove baking soda and start assembling your shoe once it dries up. title: 5 Ways To Use Rice Water For Weight Loss | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Wellness Health 5 / 5 Article Left 5 Ways Rice Water Aids In Weight Loss: Expert Shares Insights We spoke to an expert, Rohit Waghmare, a nutritionist at MultiFit , about the five ways in which rice water aids in weight loss. Keep reading to learn more about the expert insights he shared. Shivangi Sarkar Editorial Updated - 2024-06-20, 14:05 IST Rice water is the nutrient-packed starchy water left behind after cooking rice. You shouldn’t underestimate this everyday kitchen leftover that can aid in weight loss in a healthy and sustainable way. We spoke to an expert, Rohit Waghmare, a nutritionist at MultiFit, about the five ways in which rice water aids in weight loss. Keep reading to learn more about the expert insights he shared. Rice Water For Weight loss Here are five ways rice water helps with weight loss, as per Rohit Waghmare, a nutritionist at MultiFit : 1. Start Your Day With Rice Water Several studies have shown that starting your day with a glass of rice water on an empty stomach can do wonders. It can curb your appetite throughout the day, which indirectly results in a lower calorie intake. 2. Consume Rice Water Before A Meal According to several studies, if you drink a glass of rice water thirty minutes before any meal, it can reduce your overall food intake by 10-15%. As rice water is a low-calorie, high-water-content beverage, it can help ensure your overall calorie consumption is lower. Don't Miss: Top 5 Tips To Reduce Salt Intake: WHO Expert Advice 3. Smoothie Substitute If you have a sweet tooth, then rice water is a great option to use as a base in a healthy smoothie . A study published in the Journal of Nutrition found that meal replacements, such as smoothies, can enhance weight loss and improve weight maintenance, with participants losing an average of 5-10% of their body weight over six months. 4. Use Rice Water As A Soup Base For soups and stews, use rice water as a cooking liquid. According to research, soups can increase satiety and cut calories by as much as 20%, which makes them a useful weight-management tactic. 5. Add Rice Water To Green Tea Green tea has been shown to speed up metabolism on its own; infusing it with rice water can aid in weight loss. Green tea has been demonstrated to enhance weight loss benefits by 17% by increasing fat oxidation during moderate exercise. title: Expecting Twins? Top Tips For Moms And How Families Should Support Them | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Wellness Health 5 / 5 Article Left Expecting Twins? Top Tips For Moms And How Families Should Support Them Twin babies are blessings. But it can be overwhelming for a mother. Scroll down to learn tips for expecting moms and families. Anukriti Srivastava Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 04:00 IST Are you expecting twins? Then your pregnancy is going to be different from others with singleton pregnancy. However, it doesn’t mean it is going to be complicated. You just need a little lifestyle modification and guidance to sail through this phase. In light of the same, we spoke to Dr Sucheta Parte, Consultant - Obstetrician and Gynecologist, Motherhood Hospitals, Lullanagar . Scroll down to learn expert tips which will help you to successfully navigate your twin pregnancy. Tips For Mothers Here are the tips that mothers should follow: Prioritise Your Health Twin pregnancies come with challenges but are exciting for mothers. Mother needs to prioritise her health and well-being during this vital phase by adhering to various lifestyle modifications to ensure a smooth pregnancy. Ensure A Balanced Diet It will be imperative for pregnant women to pay attention to their eating habits. Try to include fresh fruits, vegetables, whole grains, pulses, and lentils in the diet. Try to cut down on junk, oily, canned, and processed foods. Eating small meals consisting of vital nutrients can help maintain energy levels and support the babies. Stay hydrated by drinking enough water, sleep well, and de-stress with the help of yoga and meditation. Timely Check Up Going for timely prenatal check-ups helps to monitor the growth of both babies and address any potential complications without any delay. Take Family Support Furthermore, having support from family members can make a huge difference in case of a twin pregnancy . Family members can assist with household chores, preparing healthy meals, or providing emotional support when one is in need. Family members should support and cooperate with mothers by making them feel comfortable; and accompanying mothers for regular check-ups and follow-ups. Don't Miss: Yoga For Pregnancy: Tailored Workouts For First, Second, And Third Trimesters, Expert Weighs In Find The Right Doctor It’s important to ensure that you seek guidance from the right healthcare provider. They will be a great support in your twin pregnancy journey. Make sure to follow their advice and get all your queries answered. Take Early Maternity Leave If you are a working professional, make sure to take early maternity leave. This will allow you to devote more time to your well-being. Also, use this time to babyproof your home. Don't Miss: Long-Term Benefits Of Natural Childbirth For Mother And Child; Expert Weighs In Follow these tips to ensure a successful twin pregnancy journey. title: International Day Of Yoga 2024 | Yoga Asanas For Kids | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Wellness Fitness 5 / 5 Article Left International Yoga Day 2024: Fun And Easy Yoga Asanas For Children Of All Age Today is the International Day of Yoga. Celebrate this day by involving your children in this ancient Indian holistic practice to contribute towards their brighter future and better well-being. Here are some Yoga asanas for them to try. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 09:03 IST Today is the International Day of Yoga which is celebrated every year on June 21 to commemorate the ancient Indian practice. It is essential to add Yoga to our daily routine for infinite health benefits. This holistic discipline can assist you in staying fit through holistic methods for mental and physical well-being. Yoga is also beneficial for expanding focus and enhancing spiritual gain. Hence, it is essential for not only adults but also children to indulge in this discipline. However, due to their fickle-mindedness and playful natures, most children avoid staying on the Yoga mat practising asanas for their fitness. To find a solution to this, we spoke to Dr Swathi Reddy (PT), Consultant Physiotherapist and certified diet counsellor, and MIAP at Motherhood Hospitals, Bengaluru . She recommends that Yoga helps children during their rapidly growing years for a sound brain and thriving body. She has curated some easy-to-follow yoga asanas for toddlers, early childhood, middle childhood, and early teens. Toddlers (Ages 2-4) The tender age between two and four invites playfulness and curiosity in children. This age group has a fleeting attention span and enjoys mischievous activities. To grab their attention, you must engage them in simple and playful Yoga asanas and present them creatively. Here are some Yoga asanas to make them try: Animal Poses (Cat-Cow Stretch) Get on your hands and knees and alternatively arch the back like a cat and straighten it like a cow. Make it creative and children-friendly by adding moo and meow sounds. Tree Pose Stand on one leg, fold and place the other foot above the knee area of the other leg, and balance your body on one leg. Pretend to be a tall tree and sway to make the asana fun for the little ones. Butterfly Pose Sit with the soles of the feet touching each other with knees apart. Swing your legs like wings to enjoy the flow. Early Childhood (Ages 5-7) Children in this age group are moving toward another stage of physical and mental development. Dr Reddy says, “For early childhood, the routine should include more elements of pretend play and the beginning of balance elements.” Here are some Yoga asanas to try: Sun Salutations Introduce a simple practice by referring to asanas as mountains, forward fold, half-bend, and step back to plank followed by the downward dog. Make it fun by telling them to catch the Sun through the Yoga flow. Warrior Pose I Place one foot back, bend the front knee, and raise your arms above the head. Tell them to imagine they are strong warriors. Warrior Pose II From Warrior I, move your hips and arms sideways and pretend to be a superhero. Cobra Pose Lay flat on the stomach, lifting the upper part of the body on hands and knees. Don't Miss: International Yoga Day 2024: Yoga Expert Tips On Boosting Energy, Improving Heart Health And Vitality Middle Childhood (Ages 8-10) Dr Reddy says, “At this stage, Yoga exercises can be more formal and would involve strength and flexibility development.” Here are some asanas she advises: Sun Salutation Sequence Add asanas like plank pose, chaturanga, upward-facing dog, and downward-facing dog to develop concentration and muscle ( Full Body Workout For Muscles ) development. Eagle Pose Place one leg over another, slightly bend your knees, and wrap your arms together. Hold and balance for better results. Double Boat Pose Sit facing a friend or family member, holding hands, pressing feet together, and lift your legs and cross them to form a V. Early Teens (Ages 11-13) “For early teens, we can introduce and explain the concept of mindfulness, new and complex postures, and relaxation methods,” advises Dr Reddy. Here are some asanas to practice: Plank Variations Standard plank, side plank, and forearm plank are basic exercises for strengthening the core muscles. Child’s Pose Dr Reddy instructs, “Kneel, sit with heels touching your bottom, with legs tucked, and stretch hands forward. Place the forehead flat on the ground to achieve a state of relaxation.” Guided Meditation Wrap up the routine with deep breathing exercises and lead your children through positive and calming thoughts. Don't Miss: What Is Mindfulness Training? Benefits And Step-By-Step Tutorial For Mindfulness Meditation; Expert Weighs In Dr Reddy says, “Yoga can be introduced as part of children’s schedule to ensure that they embrace the discipline at an early age making it a lifetime habit for healthy living. Several fun routines range from fun and playful animal movements for toddlers to graceful flowing movements for teens ensuring the activities are both fun and helpful for the different development stages of the child. Thus, the inclusion of yoga into the child’s daily routine assists parents and teachers in promoting a child’s physical and mental health and enabling a child to achieve the emotional stability required to lead a healthy life.” If you liked this story, stay tuned to HerZindagi for more! article_content: Home Wellness Health 5 / 5 Article Left International Yoga Day 2024: Yoga Expert Shares Tips On Boosting Energy, Improving Heart Health And Vitality International Yoga Day 2024 is right around the corner and we are here with some expert tips on yoga poses that help boost your energy, vitality and heart health. Jyoti Sethi Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 10:19 IST June 21 was recognised as International Yoga Day by the United Nations in 2014. This year, let us tell you how Yoga can help you improve your heart health and techniques and postures to help you boost energy and vitality. Scroll down to learn more about this from Dr Archika Sudhanshu , Spiritual and Meditation Guru. Role Of Yoga In Improving Heart Health The expert said “Yoga is a science, an art and a way of living for a healthy, happy and prosperous life. It is an ancient practice with numerous benefits for both physical and mental health and can be a powerful tool for improving heart health.” She told us about certain asanas that are particularly beneficial to reduce stress on the heart. These are usually standing poses including Tadasana (Mountain Pose) and Vrikshasana (Tree Pose) as they help to improve posture and alignment which in turn can improve circulation. Poses like Bhujangasana (Cobra), Dhanurasana (Bow), and Paschimottan asana (Seated Forward Bend) also boost circulation and help in stretching and strengthening the body. These poses promote better flow and oxygen delivery to the heart. Techniques and Postures for Boosting Energy and Vitality The expert mentioned, “Yoga is a powerful tool for both outer and inner self-development. Regular yoga practice can improve health and balance emotions. Yoga offers a natural and effective way to combat fatigue and boost your energy levels. Techniques such as Nadi Shodhana (Alternate Nostril Breathing), Surya Namaskar, and Setu Bandhasana (Bridge Pose) can help boost your energy.” If you liked this story, then please share it. title: International Yoga Day: 5 Yoga Poses To Awaken Your Body And Mind | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Wellness Fitness 5 / 5 Article Left International Yoga Day: 5 Yoga Poses To Awaken Your Body And Mind International Yoga Day is around the corner. While yoga is one of the most effective wellness practises, here are the simple asanas you can practise in the morning to kick start your day. Anukriti Srivastava Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 10:21 IST Yoga is one of the most powerful ways to ensure holistic wellness in life. While International Yoga Day is around the corner, we have handpicked a few yoga poses that you can practise in the morning to start your day on the right note. We spoke to Anchal Rout, a Delhi NCR-based Yoga and Reiki healing expert . Anchal Rout said, “Practising yoga in the morning can help create a positive mood, arrange your energy, and focus your thoughts.” Simple Morning Yoga Poses Here are five yoga poses recommended to kickstart your day, brought to you by our yoga expert: Mountain Pose (Tadasana) This is one of the most effective poses as it aids in strengthening and aligning the spine, preparing the practitioner for other poses. To get this position right, you have to join both legs, hands are to be placed near the body, and weight is to be distributed in equal measure. Breathe in deeply, bring your arms above your head, and extend them towards the ceiling like you’re attempting to grab for the sky. This position relieves tension and gives you a centre, a feeling of balance and stability. Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana) This gentle flow mobilises the spine and makes the muscles there more pliable. Stand on your four limbs, knees and wrists aligned with your shoulders and hips respectively. Inhale, bend forward, arch back, and raise your head and tailbone toward the sky. Breathe out, curve your spine, bringing your chin towards your chest and your tailbone towards the floor. Repeat for several breaths, making the transition between the two movements continuous and fluid. Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) This stimulating yoga (popular yoga asanas) posture stretches all parts of the body, increases the musculature of the arms and legs, and increases the pulse. Starting in the all-fours position, tuck your toes, and raise your hips, sternum, and legs towards the ceiling to create an inverted V shape. Place your palms and fingertips fully on the mat, unclench your neck, and look straight down at the midpoint of the mat. Stay in this position for some time, as it stretches back muscles, hamstrings and calf muscles. Don't Miss: Yoga For Pregnancy: Tailored Workouts For First, Second, And Third Trimesters, Expert Weighs In Warrior I (Virabhadrasana I) This posture strengthens the muscles and your stance and increases power and positivity. Starting position – one foot should be positioned forward, the back leg should be straight and the heel should touch the ground. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your arms up in the air and your palms facing each other, then lift your front knee to meet your hands. Tilt your hips to face the floor and pause in this position for some time before changing to the other side. In India, it is widely used due to the passing down of its disclosed advantages from one generation to the next. Itisha Arya Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 12:42 IST Amla, commonly referred to as Indian gooseberry, is a green fruit that has long been a fundamental component of Ayurvedic remedies, valued for its health advantages. Traditionally, amla fruit is relished in pickled or candied forms. Additionally, it is frequently available as a powdered supplement or in juice form, offering a convenient means to incorporate its nutritional benefits into one's diet. Our recent consultation with health specialist Dr. Ajay Pratap from Tirupati Hospital provided valuable insights into the advantages of consuming amla juic Amla Juice Helps To Improves Immunity Amla juice stands out as an excellent reservoir of vitamin C, a water-soluble antioxidant vitamin renowned for its protective properties. Amla ranks among the most abundant natural sources of vitamin C. Apart from shielding cells from oxidative stress, vitamin C is known to bolster immune cell activity. Furthermore, regular consumption of vitamin C-rich amla juice may contribute to warding off specific infections and potentially reducing the duration of common cold episodes. Drinking Amla Juice Helps In Digestion Amla juice provides numerous advantages for digestive well-being . As per insights from our health specialist, amla fruit possesses antidiarrheal attributes and has the potential to deter muscle spasms, offering relief from stomach cramps and discomfort. Additionally, amla extract is believed to aid in the healing and prevention of stomach ulcers, potentially attributable to its antioxidant properties. Drinking Amla Juice Improves Heart Health Amla juice holds promise in promoting heart health by addressing two key factors: cholesterol levels and blood pressure. By potentially reducing cholesterol levels, amla juice aids in preventing the accumulation of plaque in arteries, thereby lowering the risk of heart disease. Furthermore, regular consumption of amla juice may help regulate blood pressure, ensuring optimal levels and further bolstering cardiovascular well-being. By aiding in weight loss through improved calorie burning, a faster metabolism supports efforts to shed excess pounds. Additionally, its capacity to optimise energy production could lead to heightened vitality and enhanced overall well-being. title: Pepper Chicken Recipe | Easy Step-By-Step Recipe | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Food Recipe & Tips 5 / 5 Article Left Pepper Chicken Recipe: Easy Step-By-Step Guide To Make This Comforting Meat Dish Are you craving some delicious chicken recipe? If yes, cook this easy Pepper Chicken recipe at home and impress your friends and family. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-19, 12:00 IST South Indian cuisine is highly devoured all over the country. Their comforting flavours and healthy ingredients make them a paradise for food lovers. However, this cuisine boasts more than Idli, Dosa, and Vada. To those who have never tried their non-veg recipes, you are missing out on a lot. Discover the South Indian non-vegetarian delicacy by diving into a delicious bowl of Pepper Chicken with this easy recipe. Image courtesy: Pinterest (@alishacooking.com) Pepper Chicken Recipe Step-By-Step Make this easy step-by-step pepper chicken recipe at home with authentic South Indian flavours. Take a kadhai (wok), heat some coconut oil in it, add some fennel seeds and let them roast. Next, add some chopped onions, green chillis, and curry leaves to the oil and saute them until they turn golden brown. Now, add 2 tablespoons of ginger garlic paste, readymade or homemade, to the wok. Saute it for about 2 minutes until the raw garlicky smell goes away. Spice up the vegetables by adding salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix them well until they radiate aroma. Now add the marinated chicken pieces and mix them with the cooked masala. Ensure that the chicken gets fully coated with spices and oil. Keep the flame on low and let it cook for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked. Once the chicken is cooked, increase the flame levels to dry the gravy, if you want to eat dry pepper chicken, if not, leave the flame as it is. Ensure that the masala has coated the chicken properly. Add some coarse or finely ground black pepper for a savoury strong flavour and mix it well. Add some lemon juice for a tangy flavour and coriander leaves for garnishing. Serve with hot chapattis or South Indian parotta. Pepper Chicken Recipe Recipe Card Try this easy and delicious Pepper Chicken recipe at home. Total Time : 40 min Preparation Time : 5 min Cooking Time : 35 min Servings : 4 Cooking Level : Medium Course: Main Course Calories: 300 Cuisine: Indian Author: Rajoshi Purkait Ingredients ½ kg chicken (bone) 3 tbsp oil (preferably coconut oil) 1 tsp fennel seeds 2 large onion 3 green chilli thinly sliced 1 sprig curry leaves 2 tbsp ginger garlic paste 1 tsp turmeric powder 2 tbsp coriander powder 2 tsp garam masala powder Salt to taste 2 tbsp black pepper (freshly ground) 1 tsp lemon juice Coriander leaves garnishing Step Step 1 : Heat oil in a kadhai and sprinkle fennel seeds to sizzle. Step 2 : Add chopped onions, green chillis, and curry leaves, and saute till golden brown. Step 3 : Add ginger garlic paste and saute for some time. Step 4 : Sprinkle salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala and mix well. Step 5 : Add marinated chicken and mix well with the masala till fully coated. Step 6 : Simmer the flame and let the chicken cook for some time. Step 7 : Once done, add coarse black pepper for flavour and mix. Step 8 : Add lemon juice and coriander leaves for garnishing. Step 9 : Serve it hot! Your skin and body like you are unique. title: How To Make Idli Chaat At Home? | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Food Recipe & Tips 5 / 5 Article Left How To Make Idli Chaat At Home? Instead of preparing gujiyas or sweets this holi, prepare tasty idli chaat for your loved ones. Meenu Solanki Editorial Updated - 2024-06-20, 11:41 IST Craving for something chatapata this festive that will tantalize your taste buds? Idli Chaat is a chaat recipe that no one will be able to resist. Prepared by frying idli and mixing it with an amalgamation of spices and curd, this simple dish will provide you with a khatta-meetha taste. What’s more, is that this flavourful chaat dish can be made only in a few minutes. This chaat recipe will be loved by both kids and adults alike. So, don a chef's hat and follow this simple step by step recipe to prepare this delicious chaat. Idli Chaat Recipe Card Prepared by frying idli and mixing it with an amalgamation of spices and curd, this simple dish is perfect for this festive season. Total Time : 30 min Preparation Time : 10 min Cooking Time : 20 min Servings : 2 Cooking Level : Medium Course: Snacks Calories: 150 Cuisine: Indian Author: Meenu Solanki Ingredients 3 idlis 1/2 tsp chilli powder salt as per taste 1/2 cup yoghurt 1 green chilli 1/2 tsp urad dal 2 tbsl rice powder 1/2 tsp asafoetida 1/4 cup water 1/4 cup grated coconut 1/2 inch ginger 1/4 tsp mustard seeds 1 onion Step Step 1 : To prepare this tasty chaat, start with cutting idlis into small pieces. Step 2 : Make a thin batter by mixing water, rice powder, chilli powder, salt, and asafoetida. Step 3 : Next, heat coconut oil in a pan over medium flame. Once it is hot enough, dip the idli cubes in the batter and deep fry them until they turn golden brown. Step 4 : Now, prepare coconut-coriander chutney by mixing grated coconut, green chili, ginger, coriander leaves, and salt together. Add a tbsp of this chutney with curd and mix well. Step 5 : In a separate pan, heat coconut oil and add mustard seeds in it along with urad dal. Saute them for a few minutes and then add chopped onion, ginger paste and green chili in it. Cook for a few minutes and then turn off the flame. Step 6 : Mix fried idlis, onions, and chopped coriander leaves together. Top it with chilli powder, asafoetida and serve! Visit these restaurants in Humayunpur this weekend. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 18:40 IST Delhi’s relationship with Tibetan food is age-old. Originating in Tibet, China, the spicy and flavourful cuisine is sold at every corner of the city, however, if you want to sneak a taste of the authentic cuisine and more, Delhi’s Tibetan colonies will welcome you with open arms. If you are exhausted by the Delhi University crowd’s influx at the famous Majnu Ka Tila near Kashmiri Gate, visit Humayunpur in Safdarjung Enclave to satiate your taste buds craving authentic Chinese food. Check out these famous restaurants and cafes in the area for a happy belly. Restaurants In Humayunpur Lha Kitchen Lha Kitchen is one of the most renowned restaurants in Humayunpur serving a range of authentic Tibetan dishes. With interiors inspired by a traditional Chinese restaurant, they specialise in Tibetan, Nepalese, and Chinese cuisines. Some of their famous dishes are Aloo Sadeko, Thukpa Noodles, Kothey Momo, Tingmo, Chicken Thali, Chicken Momo, and Mojito. The cost for two people here is approximately ₹1,100. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lha kitchen (@lhakitchen.delhi) Yo Tibet Situated at the beginning of the Tibetan market, Yo Tibet is the perfect place to hang out with your friends group or lunch with your family. With an aesthetic balcony seating area, the restaurant boasts a cosy ambience and a delicious range of Tibetan, Chinese, and North Indian dishe s. Some of their best-sellers include Stir Fried Chicken, Tingmo, Egg Fried Rice, Momo, Chicken Momos, and Noodles. The cost for two people here is approximately ₹500. title: HZ Food Review: Barbeque Nation's Mouth-Watering Menu Is All You Need To Cheer Yourself Up | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Food Food Review 5 / 5 Article Left HZ Food Review: Barbeque Nation's Mouth-Watering Menu Is All You Need To Cheer Yourself Up Want to have a fun night and enjoy a culinary fest? Plan a meal at one of the Barbeque Nation's outlets for a night full of delectable culinary delights from starters to desserts. But before you make a reservation, check out this detailed food review including details about their menu, cost, taste, ambience, and more. Jyoti Sethi Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 21:29 IST Are you in the mood to try something new and delicious? Barbeque Nation's elaborate menu is all you need for a perfect outing. I recently visited their restaurant in Sector 16, Noida with my friend and had the best time! Take a look at this detailed review based on our experience and book your table at their nearest restaurant for a delightful time with your dear ones. Barbeque Nation: Cost For Two The average cost for two people at Barbeque Nation is ₹1800, however, according to their policy they charge ₹848 for their veg menu and ₹881 for the non-veg one on weekdays. On weekends, the price for their veg platter is ₹991 and ₹1191 for the non-veg platter. Barbeque Nation: Menu Barbeque Nation offers delectable treats throughout their menu from starters to desserts. They also introduced some yummy mango treats on their menu which are perfect for the season. Once you are there, you start with a wide selection of starters served at your table and move on to the buffet main course meal. Then, you can conclude your evening with lip-smacking choices on the dessert bar. Barbeque Nation: Service And Ambience The ambience at the restaurant was exemplary with live music and a soothing vibe. The service, too, was brilliant and made our experience even better. From the busboys to the manager, everybody on the staff was polite, attentive, and impeccable. Barbeque Nation: My Experience My friend tried the vegetarian menu while I ordered a curation of non-vegetarian dishes. Both of us really had a great time with yummy dishes, charming ambience and exceptional service making our experience unforgettable. Barbeque Nation: Final Verdict I would totally recommend visiting one of their outlets for a meal to remember. The dishes that won our tongues and hearts included veg kebabs, barbequed snacks, mango kulfi, and their recent additions mango cheesecake and mango drinks. article_content: Home Style Beauty 5 / 5 Article Left HZ Tried & Tested: Renee’s Refreshing Eau De Parfum Collection; Check Price, Quality, And More I tried the premium Renee’s Eau De Parfum Collection. Infused with aromatic ingredients, French-inspired perfumes offer refreshing fragrances. Check out their detailed review here. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 17:22 IST Choosing the perfect fragrance for yourself is highly essential. The right fragrance will suit your personality, be comfortable for your senses, and make you feel confident. When buying a fragrance, ensure it is long-lasting and suitable for every occasion from a casual day out to a lavish party. Whether you are seeking a fruity fragrance or a floral one, Renee’s Eau De Parfum Collection has something for everyone. Check out the detailed review of the fragrances. Claims Renee’s Eau De Parfum collection has a premium long-lasting fragrance suitable for every occasion. These are ideal for gifting purposes. RENEE Floral Fest The floral fragrance is infused with ingredients like osmanthus, rose, peony, mandarin, orange, and vanilla. RENEE Citrus Blast The refreshing citrus fragrance is made with bergamot, lemon, rose, jasmine, and musk. RENEE Aqua Bliss The rejuvenating perfume gives a seaside feel and is infused with lemon, bergamot, lily, nutmeg, cedar, and patchouli. Price Each bottle under Renee’s Eau De Parfum Collection is priced at ₹599/-. Packaging The premium, coloured glass bottles exude elegance and resemble an expensive French perfume. Don't Miss: HZ Tried & Tested: Here's A Detailed Review Of IBAEUTY Tintsome Massaging Serum My experience The perfume collection is handy and travel-friendly due to its compact size. The fragrances are refreshing and comforting and last for almost an entire day when sprayed on fabric or hair, however, they are likely to fade within a few hours when sprayed on the skin and pulse points directly. Pros The packaging is eye-catching making it appropriate for gifting. The appealing fragrances can make heads turn. Their versatile aromas make them suitable for every occasion. These products are 100% vegan ( Vegan Diet ), cruelty-free, and not tested on animals. Cons The fragrance could last longer for a day-long refreshment. Verdict All in all, Renee’s Eau De Parfum Collection is an appealing set of fragrances to aromatise yourself. Their strong and bold fragrances are perfect for any occasion. However, those who prefer spelling strong and being the centre of attention must opt for this perfume range with their eyes shut. Others must order samples to test if the fragrances suit them or not. title: Best Fabrics To Wear In Rainy Season  | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Style Fashion 5 / 5 Article Left Monsoon Clothing Guide: Best Fabrics To Wear In Rainy Season To feel comfortable and stylish during this season, you must dress accordingly. The fabric you choose to wear can have a big impact on how you feel all day. Aparna Sharma Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 17:36 IST While the arrival of monsoon gives relief from blistering heat, it presents some unique set challenges including extreme humidity and downpour. People tend to skip one of the most important aspects of this season which is proper clothing. Not wearing the appropriate fabric in this humid climate can make you sweat more than usual, leading to discomfort, itching and rashing. Best Fabrics To Wear In Rainy Season To feel comfortable and stylish during this season, you must dress accordingly. The fabric you choose to wear can have a big impact on how you feel all day. Embrace Cotton For Monsoon Comfort Cotton is perfect for the monsoon as it's breathable, light, and absorbs moisture. It keeps you cool and prevents sweat from clinging to your skin. Opt for airy fabrics like voile or chambray for better ventilation. With a variety of patterns and colors, you can stay stylish even in bad weather. Choose cotton outfits like dresses, shirts, and shorts for a cool and comfy monsoon look. Add a splash of color with vibrant rain boots! Image Courtesy: Charu Creation Light Linen for A Breezy Feel Linen’s lightweight, breathable aspect keeps you dry and comfortable. It dries quickly, ideal for sudden rain showers. Being a natural fiber, linen allows air circulation, preventing sweat and odor buildup. Go for jumpsuits, loose pants, and linen shirts for a casual and chic monsoon style . You can also try linen blends like linen-cotton and linen-rayon for more options. Don't Miss: 7 Go To Monsoon Essentials That You Must Swear By For Your Hair And Skin Needs Sleek Satin Elegance Satin is a stylish, cozy fabric that shines beautifully, perfect for strolling in the rain. Its attractive colors make it a trendy choice for your monsoon wardrobe. Check out our satin collection to create stunning tops, dresses, and skirts that will flatter your figure this monsoon. Pair them with water-resistant shoes and a stylish umbrella to brave the rain in fashion. Image Courtesy: Magicpin Don't Miss: Monsoon Vs. Rainy Season: Understanding The Key Differences Breathable Rayon Rayon is a lightweight, breathable fabric ideal for the rainy season. Its good moisture absorption and quick drying properties keep you comfortable even in high humidity. Blends like rayon-cotton or rayon-linen offer durability and reduce wrinkles. Opt for loose rayon tops, dresses, or skirts that allow airflow and won't cling to you. Remember to follow care instructions to maintain rayon's appearance and prevent shrinking. title: 5 Reasons Why Triptii Dimri Starrer Bulbbul Stands Out In The Crowd  | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Entertainment Movies News and Updates 5 / 5 Article Left 5 Reasons Why Triptii Dimri Starrer Bulbbul Stands Out In The Crowd ‘Bulbbul’ is one of the most beautiful gems that Netflix has given us. Starring Triptii Dimri, Avinash Tiwary, Paoli Dam, and Rahul Bose, the movie narrates an aching tale. Keep reading to learn what makes ‘Bulbbul’ special. Rajoshi Purkait Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 13:32 IST During the lethal coronavirus wave in 2020, Netflix released the folklore horror ‘Bulbbul’. Starring Triptii Dimri, Avinash Tiwary, Paoli Dam, and Rahul Bose, the Anushka Sharma production and Anvita Dutt Guptan directorial has been crafted soulfully with realistic sets and vintage costumes representing the British-ruled Bengal Presidency in the 1800s. Bulbbul Plot The child bride Bulbbul is a titular character married to a much older man, Indranil, with a differently-abled twin, Mahendra, and a much younger brother Satya, who becomes Bulbbul’s shoulder. Their growing closeness burns Mahendra’s heart with envy when he sends Satya to London to study while creating a threatening environment for Bulbbul. Bulbbul’s Beauty On the surface, ‘Bulbbul’ may appear to be a regular dramatic folklore. However, its many layers of good, evil, and justice are what make it worth a watch. Horror Of Reality While many believe that ‘Bulbbul’ is a horror movie due to its mystical character chudail (night hag), some may argue that the real element of horror is the portrayal of reality. The showcasing of domestic abuse, rape, and oppression is what runs shivers down your spine. Don't Miss: Imtiaz Ali's Poetry For Youth: Let Us Decode The Many Layers Of The Cult Classic Movie Tamasha Shakchunni Or Maa Kaali In Bengali folklore, Shakchunni (night hags) are spirits of women mistreated when alive and now haunt villagers. ‘Bulbbul’ escalates after the shakchunni’s birth, who drinks the blood of evil men who assault women and girls. But so did Maa Kaali when she slaughtered the devil Raktabeej. Guptan’s intelligent writing shows conflicting and subjective perceptions of good and evil. Inspired By Bengali Literature ‘Bulbbul’ has been fabulously fabricated from fragments of famous Bengali novels like Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay’s ‘Devdas’ and Rabindranath Tagore ’s ‘Chokher Bali’ and ‘Charulata’. From the childhood friends growing together angle to the character dynamics, the movie is an ode to the profound Bengali literature. Child Bride And Prejudice Bulbbul’s adversities as a child bride were portrayed with utmost transparency. From experiencing intimacy through her brother-in-law Satya to being assaulted by her husband and his twin, Guptan has highlighted a child bride's evolving interests and vulnerability. Impeccable Performances Triptii Dimri shined as Bulbbul winning millions of hearts with her transformation from childlike to fierce while Avinash Tiwary’s small yet memorable role proved his acting prowess. Paoli Dam delved into her character like water and Rahul Bose nailed his contradicting characters with comparable honesty. title: Pride Month: 10 Indian Queer Characters Breaking Stereotypes | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Entertainment Television & OTT 5 / 5 Article Left Pride Month: 10 Indian Queer Characters Breaking Stereotypes Indian cinema and television are finally giving voice to diverse LGBTQIA+ experiences. Gone are the days of cliched portrayals. Meet 10 groundbreaking characters who are challenging norms, sparking conversations, and demanding a more inclusive future on screen. Amit Diwan Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 14:06 IST As Pride Month celebrations continue, it's an opportune time to reflect on the progress made in LGBTQIA+ representation in Indian cinema and television. Over the years, both independent and commercial productions have made significant strides in portraying queer characters with authenticity and sensitivity. Let's explore ten Indian queer characters who have broken stereotypes and left a lasting impact on audiences. Indian Queer Characters Breaking Stereotypes Mathew in ‘Kaathal: The Core’ (IMDb Rating: 7.5/10) Malayalam superstar Mammootty surprised audiences with his portrayal of Mathew, a closeted gay man in a heterosexual marriage. The film, directed by Jeo Baby, tackles the complex issue of societal expectations and personal identity. Prof Ramchandra Siras in ‘Aligarh’ (IMDb Rating: 7.8/10) Based on a true story, this film depicts the life of Prof Ramchandra Siras from Aligarh Muslim University. It offers a poignant look at the challenges faced by homosexuals in academic settings and broader society. Shardul and Sumi in ‘Badhaai Do’ (IMDb Rating: 7/10) Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar portray Shardul, a gay police officer, and Sumi, a lesbian sports teacher, respectively. Their characters challenge the notion that queer individuals can't be in traditionally masculine or feminine professions. Rahul Kapoor in ‘Kapoor and Sons’ (IMDb Rating: 7.7/10) Fawad Khan 's portrayal of Rahul Kapoor dismantles the stereotype that gay men must be feminine. His character shows that sexuality doesn't dictate personality or appearance. Manickam in ‘Super Deluxe’ (IMDb Rating: 8.2/10) Vijay Sethupathi's performance as a trans woman named Manickam explores the concept of motherhood beyond biological constraints, challenging preconceptions about gender and parenting. Laila Kapoor in ‘Margarita With a Straw’ (IMDb Rating: 7.2/10) Kalki Koechlin plays Laila, a character with cerebral palsy who falls in love with a blind girl. This portrayal intersects disability and sexuality, offering a nuanced representation rarely seen in Indian cinema. Don't Miss: Loved 'Panchayat 3'? 5 Underrated Neena Gupta Movies You Cannot Miss Dev and Avinash in ‘Bombay Talkies’ (IMDb Rating: 6.6/10) Randeep Hooda and Saqib Saleem play Dev and Avinash, respectively, in one of the first mainstream portrayals of a gay relationship in Indian cinema . Dhruv and Faruq in ‘Class’ (IMDb Rating: 6.3/10) This Netflix series explores how class differences and religious backgrounds intersect with homosexuality through the characters of Dhruv and Faruq. Karan Mehra in ‘Made In Heaven’ (IMDb Rating: 8.2/10) Arjun Mathur's portrayal of Karan Mehra offers insight into the lives of gay individuals striving for acceptance in a society that often pushes back against their existence. Don't Miss: From Vadh To Ijaazat: Underrated Films That We Know You Haven't Watched Kukoo in ‘Sacred Games’ (IMDb Rating: 8.5/10) Kubbra Sait's performance as Kukoo, a transgender character, brings visibility to the trans community and explores themes of identity and acceptance. These characters represent a significant shift in Indian media's approach to LGBTQIA+ representation. By portraying queer individuals as complex, multifaceted human beings rather than caricatures, these roles contribute to greater understanding and acceptance. title: These Actresses Shot Films During Pregnancy And No One Noticed | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Entertainment Celebrities 5 / 5 Article Left These Actresses Shot Films During Pregnancy And No One Noticed Know about the inspiring stories of Bollywood actresses who defied expectations and rocked the sets while pregnant. Amit Diwan Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 16:55 IST In the glamorous world of Bollywood, where physical appearances often take centre stage, several actresses have proven that pregnancy is no barrier to their professional commitments. As Deepika Padukone prepares for her upcoming release 'Kalki 2898 AD' while expecting, let's explore the stories of other remarkable actresses who balanced filmmaking with impending motherhood. Bollywood Actresses Shot Films During Pregnancy Alia Bhatt Rising star Alia Bhatt recently revealed that she was in the final stages of her pregnancy during discussions for ‘Poacher’ with Richie Mehta. Not only that, but she also completed filming for ‘Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani’ and ‘Heart of Stone’ while pregnant, challenging the notion that motherhood signals the end of an actress's career. Kalki Koechlin During the shooting of Zee5's ‘Bhram,’ Kalki Koechlin was in her first trimester. She faced the challenge of constant nausea, with only the director and makeup artist aware of her condition. Their support ensured she received adequate rest between takes. Neha Dhupia When Neha Dhupia found herself rejected for roles due to her second pregnancy, director Behzad Khambata stepped up. He modified the script of ‘A Thursday’ to accommodate Neha's character as a pregnant cop, showcasing how the industry can adapt to support expectant mothers. Madhuri Dixit The legendary Madhuri Dixit amazed audiences with her performances in ‘Devdas,’ including the iconic ‘Dola Re Dola’ and ‘Maar Dala’ sequences, all while pregnant. Her portrayal of Chandramukhi remained graceful and captivating throughout. Jaya Bachchan Even in the 1975 film ‘Chupke Chupke,’ Jaya Bachchan worked while pregnant with her daughter Shweta. Her decision was driven by the desire to work under the esteemed director Hrishikesh Mukherjee, proving that balancing personal and professional life isn't a new concept in Bollywood. Don't Miss: Ahead Of Season 3: Iconic 'Mirzapur' Dialogues From Munna, Guddu Pandit & Others Juhi Chawla When Juhi Chawla discovered her pregnancy just before shooting ‘Ek Rishta: The Bond of Love,’ director Suniel Darshan and co-star Amitabh Bachchan rallied to support her. They adjusted schedules to complete filming before her baby bump became visible, demonstrating the industry's capacity for accommodation. Kajol Kajol's journey includes completing ‘Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham’ while pregnant, despite experiencing a miscarriage around the film's release. Later, during the filming of ‘We Are Family,’ she was pregnant with her second child, receiving exceptional care from both the film's team and her personal support system. title: Must-Watch Malayalam Movies Starter Pack For Non-Malayali Friends | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Entertainment Television & OTT 5 / 5 Article Left Must-Watch Malayalam Movies Starter Pack For Non-Malayali Friends Binge on laughter and thrills with our Malayalam movie starter pack for newbies. Amit Diwan Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 17:46 IST Are you intrigued by the captivating Malayalam films your Malayalee friends can't stop talking about? Look no further! This beginner's guide to Malayalam cinema will introduce you to some of the most celebrated films that transcend language barriers, offering a glimpse into Kerala's culture, humour, and cinematic artistry. Best of all, these films are readily available on popular streaming platforms like Hotstar, Netflix, and YouTube. ‘Bangalore Days’ (IMDb Rating: 8.3/10) Disney+ Hotstar Anjali Menon's ‘Bangalore Days’ struck a chord with younger audiences beyond Kerala's borders. This light-hearted dramedy revolves around the lives of three cousins, showcasing the strong familial bonds that are a hallmark of Menon's storytelling. The film also serves as a vibrant tribute to Bangalore, capturing the city's essence through its portrayal of IT professionals, radio jockeys, multiplexes, and the overall joie de vivre. ‘Premam’ (IMDb Rating: 8.3/10) Disney+ Hotstar ‘Premam’ became an easy crossover film for non-Malayali cinephiles. Director Alphonse Putharen breathes fresh life into a typical coming-of-age tale, following a young man's journey through various stages of love. The film's relatable storyline and Nivin Pauly's breakout performance contributed to its widespread appeal. ‘Yavanika’ (IMDb Rating: 7.9/10) Disney+ Hotstar Cinema historians regard ‘Yavanika’ as one of Malayalam cinema 's finest mystery crime thrillers. Directed by KG George, a prominent figure in the new wave movement, the film delves into the backstage drama of a travelling theatre group. Its well-paced narrative and exceptional performances continue to garner praise decades after its release. ‘Ustad Hotel’ (IMDb Rating: 8.2/10) Disney+ Hotstar Film critics praise ‘Ustad Hotel’ for its exploration of intergenerational relationships and the unifying power of food. Set in Kozhikode, the film follows the evolving bond between a grandfather and his grandson, both chefs with contrasting ideologies. With its mouthwatering food montages and stellar performances, ‘Ustad Hotel’ is considered a cinematic gem. Don't Miss: 7 Hindi Dubbed Hollywood Movies That Outshine The Originals 'Thaniyavarthanam' (IMDb Rating: 8.9/10) Amazon Prime ‘Thaniyavarthanam’ offers a poignant look at Kerala 's traditional Nair households and the impact of deep-rooted superstitions. The film tells the story of a sane man branded as lunatic due to his family's history of mental illness, culminating in a tragic ending that leaves a lasting impression on viewers ‘Kilukkam’ (IMDb Rating: 8.6/10) Disney+ Hotstar Film historians credit director Priyadarshan with introducing a new brand of comedy to Malayalam cinema. ‘Kilukkam’ follows the misadventures of a tourist guide in Ooty, blending humour with stunning visuals. The film's distinctly Malayalee brand of humour has made it a beloved classic that continues to resonate with audiences. Don't Miss: Heart-Touching Malayalam Movies Everyone Must Watch ‘My Dear Kuttichathan’ (IMDb Rating: 7.8/10) Disney+ Hotstar Cinema buffs recognise ‘My Dear Kuttichathan’ as India's first 3D film. Directed by Jijo Punnoose, this fantasy adventure about three children befriending a little ghost has left an indelible mark on the childhood memories of 80s Malayalee children. The film's seamless blend of fantasy elements and childlike wonder contributed to its enduring popularity. title: Vastu Tips For Coin Plants At Home: Keep Money Problems Away | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Astrology Vastu Vastu Shastra 5 / 5 Article Left Vastu Tips For Coin Plants At Home: Keep Money Problems Away Many people choose plants as decor items in their homes, however, you are advised to follow the vastu rules associated with them to avoid any problems in your life. Read this article to learn vastu tips for keeping coin plants at home. Jyoti Sethi Editorial Updated - 2024-06-21, 20:17 IST Also known as the Chinese Money plant, Pancake plant, Lefse plant, or Missionary plant, the coin plants are famous for their coin-shaped leaves and decorative features. However, according to vastu shastra, you must follow the rules associated with houseplants while keeping them as decor items in your home so that you don’t have to face any negative consequences. The celebrity astrologer Praduman Suri told us some vastu tips associated with keeping coin plants at home. Learn more about them in detail in this article. Vastu Tips For Keeping Coin Plants At Home The expert said that using coin plants for home and office decor can help you attract prosperity. Along with this, you have to make sure to take care of it so that its leaves never turn yellow and if they do, you should trim them or replace the plant. It is said that the leaves of a coin plant turning yellow in your home can bring you financial loss. Right Direction To Keep Coin Plant As Per Vastu The northeast direction is believed to be the most appropriate for keeping a coin plant according to vastu. However, you can also keep it in the entrance hallway of your home. This will ensure a good flow of wealth in your home. Keeping a coin plant in the southeast corner of your living room helps you attract luck and prosperity because this direction is believed to be associated with the planet Venus and Lord Ganesha and both of them are considered to be symbols of wealth and luck. The expert mentioned that those living in a north-facing home should keep this plant at the entrance, in the kitchen window, or on the balcony. Apart from this, you are advised not to keep it near the gas stove or the corners of your house as this can lead to anxiety and negativity. If you liked this story, then please share it. title: Wear These Gemstones To Get Rid Of Shani Dosh, Expert Tells Us How And Why | HerZindagi
article_content: Home Astrology Astrology Articles Astrology Tips & Remedies 5 / 5 Article Left Wear These Gemstones To Get Rid Of Shani Dosh, Expert Tells Us How And Why In Vedic astrology, Saturn is the most dreaded planet. Saturn is lord of Capricorn and Aquarius zodiac and is known as “Lord of Karma”! He can condemn you for your bad deeds and on the other hand can reward you immensely for your good deeds. Placement of Saturn in certain houses like 2nd, 4th, 5th, 8th and 12th is considered to have an adverse effect on one’s lives. However, bad influences of Saturn can be removed with Gemstone or Mantra Chanting. Jyoti Sethi Editorial Updated - 2024-06-22, 02:00 IST Gemstones for Saturn Blue Sapphire Blue Sapphire or Neelam is said to nullify the malefic effect of Saturn and bring positive changes in your life. This stone is blue in color and comes in various varieties and prices for an instance, Kashmiri Neelam, Thailand Neelam, Sri-lankan Neelam etc. This vibrate gemstone is believed to boost the potency of Saturn. Blue sapphire heals corwn chakra, stabilises one’s mind, and blesses the native with farsightedness. But, blue saphhire should be worn only after proper consultation with experts. There are certain ascendant sign like Leo, Cancer, Scorpio & Aries for which Saturn is considered to be malefic planet and wearing gemstones for Saturn can bring negative result. Even for those ascendant for which Saturn is favorable and in good houses, neelam should be worn after astrological consultation only. Amethyst Blue-Sapphire is although a very effective gemstone for Saturn but is slightly expensive. For a rescue comes, Amethyst! This purple color stone is the best sub-stone for Neelam. Amtheyst is known to control the negative energies of Saturn. This healing stone makes one free of all anxiety and stress. This stone is also recommended for natives born with unfavorable Saturn unlike Blue Sapphire. Apart from this, amethyst also calm one’s mind and drives the native towards spirituality. Even this stone is available in various varieties but comes under budget. As per vedic scripture, Saturn is son of Sun (Surya Dev). So, below mantras are dedicated to both Sun god and Saturn. Chanting these mantras on Sundays in the evening after sunset can heal the bad effects of Saturn: Om Sanischaraya Vidmahe, Sooryaputraya Dheemahi, Tanno Manda Prachodayat Nilanjana samabhasam raviputram yamagrajam. Chaya martanda sambhutam tam namami shaishcharam All the mantras except hanuman chalisa should be recited 108 times. Before reciting the mantras take bath and wear clean clothes.
